snippet: “The Invisible War,” about the epidemic of rape within the United States military, is one of the most shocking documentaries in the 2012 Human Rights Watch Film Festival.
abstract: Stephen Holden remarks on the many heroes whose stories are told in documentary films in this year's Human Rights Watch International Film Festival.
lead_paragraph: “The Invisible War,” about the epidemic of rape within the United States military, is one of the most shocking documentaries in the 2012 Human Rights Watch Film Festival.
